pull.title: Handle peer addition/removal in a right way
pull.body:
This PR makes `PeerTableModel` handle a peer addition/removal in a right way. See:
- https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/model-view-programming.html#inserting-and-removing-rows
- https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/model-view-programming.html#resizable-models

Fixes #160.

Fixes #191.

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

events.body: Rebased 734dd5f95168886e12dc2f07dd91902b1242ffc3 -> d325799acdd8d010d5e4b2f77d9cc67d76d4ad28 ([pr164.01](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.01) -> [pr164.02](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.02)) due to the conflict with #162.
Will be rebased after any progress in #161 :)

Rebased d325799acdd8d010d5e4b2f77d9cc67d76d4ad28 -> f73d340abeedf7e583fe9b2a8b3685a745a9199e ([pr164.02](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.02) -> [pr164.03](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.03)) due to the conflict with #161.
Why is this based on #18?

> Why is this based on #18?

It fixes selection behavior and handling in general.

tACK f73d340abeedf7e583fe9b2a8b3685a745a9199e

Confirming that the PR fixes the issue laid out in #160 on macOS 11.1 with Qt 5.15.2. 

On `master`: If I select a peer, and a peer above it is disconnected, then the peer I had selected becomes unselected. Below are screenshots exhibiting this behavior.

**Master:** I have selected `Peer ID 32`
![peer-is-selected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/104642534-092e6880-5679-11eb-8bcf-935ca2a9df7e.png)

**Master:** `Peer ID 32` is no longer selected because `Peer ID 29` is above it and disconnected
![peer-becomes-deselected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/104642828-6c1fff80-5679-11eb-8b9a-8f3351c9038b.png)

on this `PR`: This behavior no longer occurs. If I select a peer, it remains selected even if a peer above it is disconnected.

**PR:** `Peer ID 14` is selected
![pr-peer-selected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/104643035-b903d600-5679-11eb-8217-9e93a848b90e.png)

**PR:** `Peer ID 0` has disconnected. `Peer ID 14` remains selected.
![pr-peer-remains-selected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/104643106-dcc71c00-5679-11eb-8c43-b47166759c99.png)

Rebased f73d340abeedf7e583fe9b2a8b3685a745a9199e -> 32ce58cb18acc6eb3ac3a2c650c38b7bfdb6ad8b ([pr164.03](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.03) -> [pr164.04](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.04)) due to the conflict with #180.

Rebased 32ce58cb18acc6eb3ac3a2c650c38b7bfdb6ad8b -> a3d21d3dc3d9166a60f050352ea0eff2a8c2140b ([pr164.04](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.04) -> [pr164.05](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.05)) due to the conflict with #179.
re-ACK a3d21d3dc3d9166a60f050352ea0eff2a8c2140b, tested on macOS 11.1 Qt 5.15.2 after rebase

Rebased a3d21d3dc3d9166a60f050352ea0eff2a8c2140b -> fa95a2205e8c88b23e786a382e55f4534e7733ac ([pr164.05](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.05) -> [pr164.06](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.06)) due to the conflict with https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21015.

Rebased fa95a2205e8c88b23e786a382e55f4534e7733ac -> b7fe2b1691330166b478f0ced2dd1b6a8835729b ([pr164.06](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.06) -> [pr164.07](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.07)) due to the conflict with #166..
re-ack b7fe2b1691330166b478f0ced2dd1b6a8835729b, tested on macOS 11.2 Qt 5.15.2 after rebase
Concept ACK, right fix with nice cleanup.

Updated b7fe2b1691330166b478f0ced2dd1b6a8835729b -> 7bb0dc97ab08ebcba84b54031874c0648367d756 ([pr164.07](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.07) -> [pr164.08](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.08), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/compare/pr164.07..pr164.08)):

- addressed @Talkless' [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/164#discussion_r592667897)

Rebased 7bb0dc97ab08ebcba84b54031874c0648367d756 -> ec3075d7342b65bdd72e34f5705f6cdc8a948b67 ([pr164.08](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.08) -> [pr164.09](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.09)) due to the merging of #18.

tACK ec3075d7342b65bdd72e34f5705f6cdc8a948b67, tested on Debian Sid with Qt 5.15.2. 

Tested using two bitcoind's connected to PR's bitcoin-qt in regtest mode. Did some reconnects, and so far table seems to work fine.

events.body: Rebased ec3075d7342b65bdd72e34f5705f6cdc8a948b67 -> e102c90e41fb82e534c155bd7cfb9d0e9852c092 ([pr164.09](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.09) -> [pr164.10](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.10)) due to the conflict with #311.

Tested ACK e102c90e41fb82e534c155bd7cfb9d0e9852c092 on macos 11.2.3 with depends build.

Also ran with `-server` and while some peer was selected removing/adding others from `-cli` didn't mess with the selection. Also didn't observe weird behaviors while resizing columns.
Concept ACK. If this fixes what I think it does, it would be good to see it in v22 as a bug fix.

ACK e102c90e41fb82e534c155bd7cfb9d0e9852c092

Tested functionality on `Arch Linux Qt 5.15.2`, `macOS 11.3 Qt 5.15.2`, and cross-compile from Linux to `Windows 10`.

## Notes on Commits:
- [x] efb7e5aa962d4a4047061996bbb50b6da4592cbc
  - code review ACK cross-checked with Qt docs for [QAbstractTableModel](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qabstracttablemodel.html) and [QAbstractItemModel](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qabstractitemmodel.html)
- [x] 1b66f6e556631a1a2d89aefba70a79894bd14fcd
  - code review ACK, the `PeerTablePriv` class would no longer be needed.
- [x] e102c90e41fb82e534c155bd7cfb9d0e9852c092
  - code review ACK, patch looks correct in its implementation in following recommendations from Qt docs
  - some nits ([1](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/164#discussion_r646312163), [2](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/164#discussion_r646313034), [3](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/164#discussion_r646313458))
## Screenshots:

The below screenshots show that this PR will close the mutated version of #160 (see, https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/issues/160#issuecomment-855515389). While I am not including videos showing that this PR also fixes #191, I can confirm that it does on all three tested platforms.

### Arch Linux

#### master

| Select Peer  6   | Disconnect Peer 0, Peer 7 is now selected  |
| --------------- | --------------------------------------------- |
| ![master0start](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120961948-cc006b00-c72c-11eb-8c62-510df6b612b8.png) | ![master-disconnect](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120961968-d589d300-c72c-11eb-821b-fd4e9e274b68.png) |

#### PR

| Select Peer  9   | Disconnect Peer 1, Peer 9 remains selected   |
| --------------- | ----------------------------------------------- |
| ![linux-pr-start](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120962058-fe11cd00-c72c-11eb-9066-100eab8ead56.png) | ![linux-pr-disconnect](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120962066-01a55400-c72d-11eb-93a6-eb92ddcb8984.png) |

### macOS 11.3

#### master

| Select Peer  6   | Disconnect Peer 0, Peer 7 is now selected  |
| --------------- | --------------------------------------------- |
| ![Screen Shot 2021-06-06 at 9 17 11 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120947119-be3aed80-c70c-11eb-99e1-ad9a739df5be.png) | ![Screen Shot 2021-06-06 at 9 17 48 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120947129-c430ce80-c70c-11eb-9c5a-8b4f32a07d7f.png) |

#### PR
| Select Peer  8   | Disconnect Peer 0, Peer 8 remains selected  |
| --------------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| ![macOS-pr-start](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120961800-7e83fe00-c72c-11eb-8ad1-7cdb31ce42ba.png) | ![macOS-pr-disconnect](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120961867-9d829000-c72c-11eb-8aa3-64bb3f7d78ef.png) |

### Windows 10

Note: Difference between UI on master and PR is because master includes ab86ac7739b27f2c45ae72ce4c4ebecf324b3e90

#### master

| Select Peer  4   | Disconnect Peer 0, Peer 6 is now selected  |
| --------------- | --------------------------------------------- |
| ![windows-master-start](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120962261-5e087380-c72d-11eb-8c43-7b56d1c4e7f7.png) | ![windows-master-disconnect](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120962268-6496eb00-c72d-11eb-9aa5-b9295264986b.png) |

#### PR

| Select Peer  5  | Disconnect Peer 1, Peer 5 remains selected  |
| --------------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| ![windows-start-pr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120962495-d838f800-c72d-11eb-83d4-5a2a93431282.png) | ![windows-disconnect-pr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/120962519-e2f38d00-c72d-11eb-871c-8103ee39f06d.png) |

tree b1d388631085d86928d58634b673a1ba0ff101ee
parent 1b66f6e556631a1a2d89aefba70a79894bd14fcd
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1613980626 +0200
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1623076660 +0300

qt: Handle peer addition/removal in a right way

This change fixes a bug when a multiple rows selection gets inconsistent
after a peer addition/removal.

events.message:
qt: Handle peer addition/removal in a right way

This change fixes a bug when a multiple rows selection gets inconsistent
after a peer addition/removal.

events.body:
Updated e102c90e41fb82e534c155bd7cfb9d0e9852c092 -> ecbd91153875c8cdd5b92b840afc116f65e457fb ([pr164.10](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.10) -> [pr164.11](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr164.11), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/compare/pr164.10..pr164.11)):

- addressed recent @jarolrod's comments
reACK ecbd91153875c8cdd5b92b840afc116f65e457fb just improvements to the comment since last review.

re-ACK ecbd911

Only changes since last review are implementation of comment nits

comments.body: nit: could be noexcept, since it just returns pointer. Though since other similar getters here does not use `noexcept`, adding that one kinda seems out of scope.

These stats has quite a few members, and they all gonna be overwritten after construction. Since it's loop, consider initializing in this wat:
```
const CNodeCombinedStats stats{std::get<0>(node_stats), std::get<2>(node_stats), std::get<1>(node_stats)};
```

 It's most dissapointing that `QList` does not have `emplace()` here...
nit: `{}` seems redundant, it's not fundamental type like int, pointer or bool to need this kind of explicit default initialization, constructor will be invoked regardless.
nit: if one likes C++11 toys, one could write `= {}` instead of ` = QModelIndex()`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,43 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2020 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#include <qt/peertablesortproxy.h>
+
+#include <qt/peertablemodel.h>
+#include <util/check.h>
+
+#include <QModelIndex>
+#include <QString>
+#include <QVariant>
+
+PeerTableSortProxy::PeerTableSortProxy(QObject* parent)
+    : QSortFilterProxyModel(parent)
comments.body: nit: since you use `{}` in `m_peer_table_sort_proxy{nullptr};`, maybe worth using `{}` in `QSortFilterProxyModel{parent}` too (meaning in the new code)?
On My Machine, it seems only `#include <interfaces/node.h>` is needed?

Though since other similar getters here does not use `noexcept`, adding that one kinda seems out of scope.

Going to leave it as is.
Yes, it is redundant. Leaving as is to be explicit.

comments.body: ~As stated in the commit description, the goal is to follow Qt [docs](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qabstracttablemodel.html#index).~ wrong comment
That commit only adds `#include <qt/peertablesortproxy.h>`, and other `include`s are sorted only. I'd leave the need of the `interfaces/node.h` header out of this pr scope.
As stated in the commit description, the goal is to follow Qt [docs](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qabstracttablemodel.html#index).

comments.body: This commit belongs to the #18 pr which this one is based on.
Thanks! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/164#issuecomment-797463817).
Sorry, missed the fact that it's a sort.

> Ugh, my suggestion was not good enought...

It seems like a kind of premature optimization, no?

Maybe, probably. Since there will be mostly on up to ~128 nodes by default, "nobody" would care if there are some extra copies I guess, and `std::transform` variant do look particularly "noisy" (i.e. "optimization" not worth the effort/readability cost).
FWIW I've suggested that this should not be "global" but rather instanced for each view (currently one in console dialog).

nit, or something similar
```suggestion
    // Handle new peer addition or removal as suggested in Qt Docs. See:
```
Thanks! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/164#issuecomment-855996526).
[Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/164#issuecomment-855996526).
[Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/164#issuecomment-855996526).
